DOC.brief_title: Does Capnography Prevent Hypoxemia During Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography Endoscopic Ultrasound ?
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects undergo elective ERCP EUS receive standard monitoring sedation . In addition , capnography measure carbon dioxide level graphically assess respiratory activity use . Subjects randomize either capnography blind titration arm . In capnography titration arm , endoscopy team would make aware capnographic abnormality arise throughout procedure . In capnography blind arm , information available endoscopy team represent standard care . It hypothesis use capnography prevent low oxygen level know hypoxemia , procedure . The primary outcome study proportion patient hypoxemia two arm . Review literature indicate incidence hypoxemia without supplemental oxygen varies 30-70 % . Our sample size calculation base reduction hypoxemia incidence 40 % 20 % . Secondary outcome proportion patient oxygen requirement , major hypoxemia apnea ( lack respiratory activity via capnography least 15 second ) two arm . We perform univariable multivariable analysis determine risk factor apnea .
DOC.criteria: Adults age 18 great Subjects undergoing elective ERCP EUS ASA class 13 Inpatient outpatient Able give inform consent ASA Class 4 5 Emergent procedure Procedures require MAC sedation Subjects unable give inform consent Subjects oxygen procedure Subjects CPAP/BiPAP Allergies fentanyl/demerol/midazolam
